title: Speaking of Crowd Funding Shroud of Turin Projects:   Should We Laugh or Cry?
post: It’s all to do with playing around with the genre. They’ve done William Shakespeare with zombies, vampires and Nazi SS. I’ve seen King Lear done with medieval Japanese warlords. WS has been popular in India for yonks, all done in local dialects. TV has been taking liberties with Jane Austen. Andrew Lloyd Webber’s Superstar had a battery of Israeli tanks.  Jesus is now right up there with Shakespeare and Austen!
author: daveb of wellington nz
